data: {"title":"Gyokeres decision made as Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets","description":"The latest Manchester United transfer news as Ruben Amorim remains linked with recruiting a striker for his new squad","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-decision-made-ruben-30454275","content":"Viktor Gyokeres decision made as Ruben Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Viktor Gyokeres decision made as Ruben Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news as Ruben Amorim remains linked with recruiting a striker for his new squad
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

James QuinlanSport Trends Writer

*   16:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres of Sweden jogs](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30418360.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185006421.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres of Sweden and Sporting CP (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

A report from Germany has named four striker transfer targets Ruben Amorim and [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) chiefs are 'discussing', though Viktor Gyokeres is a shock omission. As [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) arrived to begin his [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) project during the international break, one of the key issues he immediately faces is how to relight the goalscoring fire in his new squad.

He seemed to have done so when [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) - starting centrally - netted inside two minutes against Ipswich Town, though that would prove to be their only strike in what turned out to be a 1-1 draw. Now 12 matches into the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) campaign, Man United have only scored 13 times.

Contributing to that total, £72m signing [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and £36.5m signing [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) have only found the net once each. This has prompted [intense transfer rumours around Amorim's arrival](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109), particular concerning the striker he signed from Coventry City to Sporting CP a little over 12 months ago, Gyokeres.

**READ MORE: [Man United transfer news LIVE updates](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-transfer-news-live-30442382)**

**READ MORE: [Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Amorim tipped to complete transfer](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524)**

The Sweden international has scored 67 goals in 69 appearances across all competitions since making the move to Portugal, so has been highlighted as a possible and very exciting answer to United's centre forward conundrum. However, the new manager has admitted he [will not look to steal from his former club](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-already-hinted-first-30367354#:~:text=%22I%20won't%20%5Bsign,know%2C%20we'll%20see.) during the January window, [nor does Gyokeres have any ambition to make a switch](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-breaks-silence-man-30387160) midway through the current season.

A new report from [Sky Germany](https://sport.sky.de/transfer/news/34132/13260554/marmoush-boniface-davies-transfer-themen-bei-manchester-united) now claims Amorim and United chiefs have been talking over the addition of an attacker and the Sporting player does not feature amongst the four stated.

The first is Paris Saint-Germain's Randal Kolo Muani. Out of form in the French capital, a loan or full purchase are allegedly open in January though he is not a 'hot topic', despite some interest, at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

Second is Eintracht Frankfurt's Omar Marmoush. The Egyptian has 14 goals for the season already, is 'in the club's sights' and would cost in the region of £41.7m-£50.1m. [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) have also been rumoured to be interested.

Third on Amorim's mind is apparently Bayer Leverkusen's Victor Boniface. It would 'cost a lot of money' to pry the Nigerian, who has scored 29 in 49 outings, from Xabi Alonso's team.

The final striker linked in this latest report is Victor Osimhen. The Serie A-winning hero publicly fell out with Napoli over an exit from the club, was unable to find a suitor willing to pay the £109m release clause at the time and he ended up on loan at Galatasaray for this season.

In Turkey so far the 25-year-old has netted eight goals, with a new £62.6m release at Napoli set to come into effect from January that would benefit United.

data: {"title":"Gyokeres decision made as Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets","description":"The latest Manchester United transfer news as Ruben Amorim remains linked with recruiting a striker for his new squad","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-decision-made-ruben-30454275","content":"Viktor Gyokeres decision made as Ruben Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Viktor Gyokeres decision made as Ruben Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news as Ruben Amorim remains linked with recruiting a striker for his new squad
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

James QuinlanSport Trends Writer

*   16:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres of Sweden jogs](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30418360.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185006421.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres of Sweden and Sporting CP (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

A report from Germany has named four striker transfer targets Ruben Amorim and [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) chiefs are 'discussing', though Viktor Gyokeres is a shock omission. As [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) arrived to begin his [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) project during the international break, one of the key issues he immediately faces is how to relight the goalscoring fire in his new squad.

He seemed to have done so when [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) - starting centrally - netted inside two minutes against Ipswich Town, though that would prove to be their only strike in what turned out to be a 1-1 draw. Now 12 matches into the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) campaign, Man United have only scored 13 times.

Contributing to that total, £72m signing [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and £36.5m signing [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) have only found the net once each. This has prompted [intense transfer rumours around Amorim's arrival](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109), particular concerning the striker he signed from Coventry City to Sporting CP a little over 12 months ago, Gyokeres.

**READ MORE: [Man United transfer news LIVE updates](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-transfer-news-live-30442382)**

**READ MORE: [Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Amorim tipped to complete transfer](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524)**

The Sweden international has scored 67 goals in 69 appearances across all competitions since making the move to Portugal, so has been highlighted as a possible and very exciting answer to United's centre forward conundrum. However, the new manager has admitted he [will not look to steal from his former club](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-already-hinted-first-30367354#:~:text=%22I%20won't%20%5Bsign,know%2C%20we'll%20see.) during the January window, [nor does Gyokeres have any ambition to make a switch](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-breaks-silence-man-30387160) midway through the current season.

A new report from [Sky Germany](https://sport.sky.de/transfer/news/34132/13260554/marmoush-boniface-davies-transfer-themen-bei-manchester-united) now claims Amorim and United chiefs have been talking over the addition of an attacker and the Sporting player does not feature amongst the four stated.

The first is Paris Saint-Germain's Randal Kolo Muani. Out of form in the French capital, a loan or full purchase are allegedly open in January though he is not a 'hot topic', despite some interest, at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

Second is Eintracht Frankfurt's Omar Marmoush. The Egyptian has 14 goals for the season already, is 'in the club's sights' and would cost in the region of £41.7m-£50.1m. [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) have also been rumoured to be interested.

Third on Amorim's mind is apparently Bayer Leverkusen's Victor Boniface. It would 'cost a lot of money' to pry the Nigerian, who has scored 29 in 49 outings, from Xabi Alonso's team.

The final striker linked in this latest report is Victor Osimhen. The Serie A-winning hero publicly fell out with Napoli over an exit from the club, was unable to find a suitor willing to pay the £109m release clause at the time and he ended up on loan at Galatasaray for this season.

In Turkey so far the 25-year-old has netted eight goals, with a new £62.6m release at Napoli set to come into effect from January that would benefit United.

data: {"title":"Gyokeres decision made as Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets","description":"The latest Manchester United transfer news as Ruben Amorim remains linked with recruiting a striker for his new squad","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-decision-made-ruben-30454275","content":"Viktor Gyokeres decision made as Ruben Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                     

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Viktor Gyokeres decision made as Ruben Amorim 'discusses' four Man United transfer targets
==========================================================================================

The latest Manchester United transfer news as Ruben Amorim remains linked with recruiting a striker for his new squad
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

James QuinlanSport Trends Writer

*   16:30, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres of Sweden jogs](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30418360.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185006421.jpg)

Viktor Gyokeres of Sweden and Sporting CP (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

A report from Germany has named four striker transfer targets Ruben Amorim and [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) chiefs are 'discussing', though Viktor Gyokeres is a shock omission. As [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) arrived to begin his [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) project during the international break, one of the key issues he immediately faces is how to relight the goalscoring fire in his new squad.

He seemed to have done so when [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) - starting centrally - netted inside two minutes against Ipswich Town, though that would prove to be their only strike in what turned out to be a 1-1 draw. Now 12 matches into the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) campaign, Man United have only scored 13 times.

Contributing to that total, £72m signing [Rasmus Hojlund](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/rasmus-hojlund) and £36.5m signing [Joshua Zirkzee](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/joshua-zirkzee) have only found the net once each. This has prompted [intense transfer rumours around Amorim's arrival](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-can-start-ruben-30445109), particular concerning the striker he signed from Coventry City to Sporting CP a little over 12 months ago, Gyokeres.

**READ MORE: [Man United transfer news LIVE updates](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-transfer-news-live-30442382)**

**READ MORE: [Mainoo gets shock Man United warning as Amorim tipped to complete transfer](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/kobbie-mainoo-gets-shock-man-30451524)**

The Sweden international has scored 67 goals in 69 appearances across all competitions since making the move to Portugal, so has been highlighted as a possible and very exciting answer to United's centre forward conundrum. However, the new manager has admitted he [will not look to steal from his former club](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-already-hinted-first-30367354#:~:text=%22I%20won't%20%5Bsign,know%2C%20we'll%20see.) during the January window, [nor does Gyokeres have any ambition to make a switch](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-breaks-silence-man-30387160) midway through the current season.

A new report from [Sky Germany](https://sport.sky.de/transfer/news/34132/13260554/marmoush-boniface-davies-transfer-themen-bei-manchester-united) now claims Amorim and United chiefs have been talking over the addition of an attacker and the Sporting player does not feature amongst the four stated.

The first is Paris Saint-Germain's Randal Kolo Muani. Out of form in the French capital, a loan or full purchase are allegedly open in January though he is not a 'hot topic', despite some interest, at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

Second is Eintracht Frankfurt's Omar Marmoush. The Egyptian has 14 goals for the season already, is 'in the club's sights' and would cost in the region of £41.7m-£50.1m. [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) have also been rumoured to be interested.

Third on Amorim's mind is apparently Bayer Leverkusen's Victor Boniface. It would 'cost a lot of money' to pry the Nigerian, who has scored 29 in 49 outings, from Xabi Alonso's team.

The final striker linked in this latest report is Victor Osimhen. The Serie A-winning hero publicly fell out with Napoli over an exit from the club, was unable to find a suitor willing to pay the £109m release clause at the time and he ended up on loan at Galatasaray for this season.

In Turkey so far the 25-year-old has netted eight goals, with a new £62.6m release at Napoli set to come into effect from January that would benefit United.

data: {"title":"Viktor Gyokeres has finally 'made up his mind' on the club he wants to join in blockbuster transfer","description":"Viktor Gyokeres has been linked with a move away from Sporting Clube de Portugal.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-sporting-transfer-news-274064-20241126","content":"Viktor Gyokeres has finally 'made up his mind' on the club he wants to join in blockbuster transfer - Transfer News - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Sporting Clube de Portugal star man Viktor Gyokeres has reportedly decided his next club.**

Gyokeres is one of the most sought-after players in Europe after yet another fine start to the season.

So far, the Swedish international has scored 24 goals in 19 appearances across all competitions. The 26-year-old also has four assists to his name.

As a result of his spectacular form, Gyokeres has been linked with a host of different clubs around the continent, including the likes of Manchester United, Liverpool, Arsenal, Chelsea, Paris Saint Germain and Barcelona.

Advert

However, since Ruben Amorim left Sporting for Old Trafford, reports linking Gyokeres with a move to [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) have picked up.

It has now been claimed that the striker has made up his mind on which club he wants to join in the future.

As [reported](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31946840/arsenal-barcelona-make-isak-transfer-target-gyokeres-man-utd/) by The Sun, Gyokeres has his eyes set on a move to Old Trafford, in what would be a reunion with former boss [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim).

The report stated: "SunSport understands Sporting Lisbon striker Gyokeres has his heart set on a move to the Premier League and a reunion with ex-boss Ruben Amorim at Manchester United."

Advert

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres has been linked with a move to the Premier League. Image](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltea6c744748278d4f/674600d15f42e681c4496cfc/GettyImages-2185446637.jpg)

Getty

Before joining United, Amorim was asked about potentially reuniting with Gyokeres at Old Trafford.

The Portuguese said: "No, no, no. I cannot be funny with that in this moment. It was tough for me to leave, if I start joking about that with Gyokeres, I’ll have problems. This is my city, this is my country, I will respect.

"Viktor has to stay until the end of the season and then his life is going, maybe, somewhere else."

Advert

When asked about about Amorim, Gyokeres himself said: "We will miss him a lot, of course.

"We achieved a lot together and we will miss him and the other members of the staff, but they are leaving and we have to move on and face the next challenge we have."

Gyokeres is set to start for Sporting as they resume their UEFA Champions League campaign against Arsenal at the Estadio Jose Alvalade on Tuesday night.

**Sporting Clube de Portugal star man Viktor Gyokeres has reportedly decided his next club.**

Gyokeres is one of the most sought-after players in Europe after yet another fine start to the season.

So far, the Swedish international has scored 24 goals in 19 appearances across all competitions. The 26-year-old also has four assists to his name.

As a result of his spectacular form, Gyokeres has been linked with a host of different clubs around the continent, including the likes of Manchester United, Liverpool, Arsenal, Chelsea, Paris Saint Germain and Barcelona.

Advert

However, since Ruben Amorim left Sporting for Old Trafford, reports linking Gyokeres with a move to [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) have picked up.

It has now been claimed that the striker has made up his mind on which club he wants to join in the future.

As [reported](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31946840/arsenal-barcelona-make-isak-transfer-target-gyokeres-man-utd/) by The Sun, Gyokeres has his eyes set on a move to Old Trafford, in what would be a reunion with former boss [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim).

The report stated: "SunSport understands Sporting Lisbon striker Gyokeres has his heart set on a move to the Premier League and a reunion with ex-boss Ruben Amorim at Manchester United."

Advert

![Image 1: Viktor Gyokeres has been linked with a move to the Premier League. Image](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltea6c744748278d4f/674600d15f42e681c4496cfc/GettyImages-2185446637.jpg)

Getty

Before joining United, Amorim was asked about potentially reuniting with Gyokeres at Old Trafford.

The Portuguese said: "No, no, no. I cannot be funny with that in this moment. It was tough for me to leave, if I start joking about that with Gyokeres, I’ll have problems. This is my city, this is my country, I will respect.

"Viktor has to stay until the end of the season and then his life is going, maybe, somewhere else."

Advert

When asked about about Amorim, Gyokeres himself said: "We will miss him a lot, of course.

"We achieved a lot together and we will miss him and the other members of the staff, but they are leaving and we have to move on and face the next challenge we have."

data: {"title":"Mark Goldbridge reveals he reached out to one Man Utd player after issues turned toxic","description":"The incident happened in November last year.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-premier-league-mark-goldbridge-united-stand-370460-20241126","content":"Mark Goldbridge reveals he reached out to one Man Utd player after issues turned toxic - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Mark Goldbridge reached out to Marcus Rashford and his agent after the Manchester United forward asked YouTube channel The United Stand to "stop spreading malicious rumours" on social media.**

Back in November last year, [**The United Stand**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rgJbBjOetmc&ab_channel=TheUnitedStand) – a channel founded by Goldbridge – made a video with the title: 'Rashford Future In Doubt?'

"Given Rashford's injury against Fulham and his recent subpar performances, the question arises: should he still be a regular starter for [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd)?" the video description read. "Furthermore, with [Amad](https://www.sportbible.com/amad-diallo) returning, will he be given playing time?"

Advert

The United Stand posted a link to the YouTube video on [**X**](https://x.com/UnitedStandMUFC/status/1721467212756558266), formerly Twitter, at 9:59am and around an hour later, [Rashford](https://www.sportbible.com/marcus-rashford) responded by saying: "Please STOP spreading malicious rumours."

Marcus Rashford confronts angry Manchester United fan during warm up

Just over a year later and United fan [Goldbridge](https://www.sportbible.com/mark-goldbridge) was asked about Rashford's response during a guest appearance on YouTube channel [**Webby & O'Neill**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NWnvDVIe3Og&ab_channel=Webby%26O%27Neill).

Here's how the conversation played out between Tony O'Neill and Mark Goldbridge.

Advert

**O'Neill**: "I'm going to talk about a player here, it's very controversial, in many ways, with his form and off-field antics. But you caused a big stir, and he caused a bigger stir, when he reacted to your YouTube channel. And that's Marcus Rashford.

"He posted a comment on one of your tweets. He said: 'Please stop spreading malicious rumours.'

"Now for a player to come out, and accuse you of spreading lies... what was your reaction?"

![Image 1: Marcus Rashford left a comment on The United Stand's post. Image credit: YouTube/Webby & O'Neill](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt4e6718bfa37fd358/6745bca564734a1633b20477/Screenshot_2024-11-26_at_12.14.47.png)

Marcus Rashford left a comment on The United Stand's post. Image credit: YouTube/Webby & O'Neill

Advert

**Goldbridge**: "It's disappointing. Ultimately, I would love to see Marcus Rashford play good football for Manchester United and score goals. That's all that matters. I don't really care what he's like as a person. That's the bottom line.

"But in relation to that situation, we tried to reach out to his agent but got nothing back, to sort of say, 'C'mon. This is a guy who is doing book deals and charity work, and you are replying to something that's out of context. Look at the s\*\*\*storm it has caused.

"I'd say 75 per cent of people are saying, 'Oh, go on Rashford, well done' but 25 per cent are going, 'What are you doing?'. I also said, we aren't The Sun or talkSPORT, have you looked at what they are saying today?

"All we said was, 'Is Rashford's future in doubt?' Is that malicious? He was playing awful at the time. Why go after The United Stand? Why not go after another YouTube channel or a website.

Advert

"Is was either really naive and silly, which is concerning, or calculated to cause us trouble. This is one of the biggest earners and reputation players at Manchester United and you're getting involved in a Twitter thing like that."

![Image 2: Image credit: Getty ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/blt2ca71775290a8a08/6745c79671787a0cd1c99186/GettyImages-1774345271.jpg)

Image credit: Getty

He added: "And if he is bothered, that's even more worrying about how the mentality of the modern player is. Ultimately, that was nothing about getting booted out, it was about him not playing well and if Garnacho was going to take his place."

**An Ipswich Town fan who was stood next to Roy Keane as he clashed with another supporter has opened up on what happened during the heated incident at Portman Road.**

In the aftermath of Sunday's Premier League clash between [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) and Ipswich, a furious Keane [was spotted confronting a supporter](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/roy-keane-man-utd-ipswich-fan-incident-887466-20241125) during an ad break.

Footage soon emerged of the heated incident, where Keane can be heard telling the supporter: "I’ll wait for you in the car park and we can discuss it."

Advert

Keane, who was punditry duty for Sky Sports, calmly headed back to the pitch after security and stewards diffused the situation. [Jamie Redknapp](https://www.sportbible.com/jamie-redknapp), meanwhile, was heard telling the group to "just leave it".

Now, season ticket holder Neil Finbow, 55, has given a further insight into the row after standing right next to the former Manchester United captain as the incident played out.

"It was the guy in the middle's comments that got him, I think," Finbow told [**The Mirror**](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/ipswich-fan-roy-keane-manutd-34181330). "He was going on about his time when he was manager, how he treated his kids."

Finbow continued: "I will sort of defend [Roy Keane](https://www.sportbible.com/roy-keane) here as well, because it may be that the comment 'I'll see you in the car park' is to talk to the guy rather than take him out, so it can be misconstrued. I thought he was being quite aggressive, in hindsight.

Advert

"The guy had an issue, when \[Keane\] was at the club, when you see him point he was pointing to 'when you were here in the car park, you ignored my kids and swore at them', and he had an issue with that. So obviously that's been pent-up."

He added: "I don't have any regrets \[about going down the front\]. It's pent-up anger. No swear words came out of my mouth, I just said 'you're a better pundit than you are a manager'."

Sky Sports will reportedly investigate the incident to see if any action is needed, while Finbow admits he is concerned about the future of his season ticket.

"Everyone I sit with knows what I'm like," he said. "I'm in the family bit there, I've been there for years. I do worry about my season ticket, someone has put on there that it could affect it, but I don't think I've been abusive or anything. If people class that as abuse then it's just gone mad."

Advert

**Liverpool superstar Mohamed Salah has spoken out about his current contract negotiations with the club, and fans are shocked.**

On Sunday, [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) continued their impressive form in the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) this season [as they came back to beat Southampton 3-2 at St Mary's Stadium.](https://www..com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-southampton-arne-slot-336586-20241124)

As he has been on several occasions this season, [Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/mohamed-salah) was central to Liverpool's success in the match, scoring a brace to equalise and later win the hard-fought match.

Advert

Speaking after Sunday's win against Southampton, Salah said: "We are almost in December and I haven't received any offers yet to stay in the club. I'm probably more out than in.

"You know I have been in the club for many years. There is no club like this. But in the end it is not in my hands. As I said, it is December and I haven't received anything yet about my future.

Advert

"I love the fans. The fans love me. In the end it is not in my hands or the fans' hands."

The Egyptian winger was then asked by reporters if he was disappointed about the current situation, he confessed: "Of course, yeah. I'm not going to retire soon so I'm just playing, focusing on the season and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well.

"I'm disappointed but we will see.

"I am very professional. Everybody can see my work ethic. I'm just trying to enjoy my football and I will play at the top level as long as possible."

Advert

Having played such a pivotal role in Liverpool's success in recent years, many fans believe Salah has earned the right to extend his stay with the club, extending his current deal which sees him earn £350,000 per week.

Reacting to the 32-year-old's shocking revelation on social media, one fan wrote: "Is this club actually serious?? Practically December and not an offer to our best player. Sort it out."

While one suggested: "Start protesting lads. Get the banners out this is an absolute disgrace."

Not nowOK

**Former Manchester United midfielder Owen Hargreaves has revealed that new manager Ruben Amorim was not happy with three players on the touchline during his side's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.**

Amorim was standing in the dugout for the first time as [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) manager at Portman Road, and saw his side get off to the ideal start as they went 1-0 up in 80 seconds through Marcus Rashford.

While certain aspects will have pleased [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim), such as the performances of Amad Diallo and Andre Onana, other parts of the display will no doubt be familiar after the hours of match analysis the 39-year-old will have done in recent weeks.

Advert

Ipswich would equalise before half-time through Omari Hutchinson's deflected long-range effort, and Kieran McKenna's side looked more likely to go on and win the game in the second half.

Speaking on Sky Sports after the game, Amorim was honest in his assessment of how United performed on the day and the work that needs to be done.

He also namedropped several players, [including centre-back Jonny Evans](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-ipswich-955493-20241124), when looking back at moments that could have been handled differently during the game.

Advert

But Hargreaves, who was sat behind the new manager in the stands as a pundit for [Premier League Productions](https://www.premierleague.com/), has revealed Amorim's private frustrations on the touchline with three other United players in particular.

He explained: "He was pretty frustrated, I'm not going to lie. He was right in front of me and he was really, really frustrated with a lot of things.

"I think initially, Dalot's positioning, I think he was a little bit frustrated with that in the first half.

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim watches on from the sideline during Man Utd's 1-1 draw with Ipswich (Image: Getty)](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltd251eccabd89b5ee/67442a273b4e9ee9027080dc/Ruben-Amorim-Man-Utd-Ipswich.jpg)

Ruben Amorim watches on from the sideline during Man Utd's 1-1 draw with Ipswich (Image: Getty)

Advert

"I think the midfield balance he didn't really like, and when Zirkzee came on I don't think he was overly happy with his positioning, and Hojlund as well. So there's a lot of stuff that needs a little bit of work.

"Before the game, we saw all those smiles and all that charm from Ruben Amorim. But during the game, he was really frustrated. I think he realised this is going to be a lot harder than he envisioned."

‘Exactly what we need’: Diogo Dalot praises Ruben Amorim’s high demands
=======================================================================

*   Clarity of coach’s messaging also impresses defender
*   He says Amorim’s philosophy suits Manchester United

Diogo Dalot believes Ruben Amorim is precisely what [Manchester United](https://www.theguardian.com/football/manchester-united) need as he talked up the clarity of the new head coach’s messaging and his highly demanding nature.

Amorim’s first match was Sunday’s [1-1 draw at Ipswich](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/24/ipswich-manchester-united-premier-league-match-report). Had Erik ten Hag still been in charge, the inquest would have raged because of the level of the performance and the context. Ipswich are in the relegation places. They have not won at home in the Premier League since April 2002.

[First Premier League weekend on Bluesky was nice and soft but X hard-edges remain John Brewin Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/25/first-premier-league-weekend-on-bluesky-was-nice-and-soft-but-x-hard-edges-remain)

As it was, there were mainly shrugs, an acceptance that United have fallen far and the transition to Amorim’s 3-4-2-1 system will take time. He was able to deliver brutal truths without the fear of comeback, specifically the line about how United will have to [“suffer for a long period”](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/24/ruben-amorim-says-manchester-united-will-suffer-after-fast-start-fizzles-out) before their fortunes turn.

It was a day when United had to look hard for the positives, although there was a glimpse of how Amorim wants to attack. When Amad Diallo surged up the right in the second minute, he had three options in the box for the cross. Marcus Rashford made the run to the near post but Alejandro Garnacho and Dalot – having sprinted up from left wing-back – were behind him. Amad picked out Rashford for 1-0.

Dalot sought to highlight what Amorim had brought in the preparations, albeit they were short as a consequence of many of the players being involved with their countries during the international break.

“It’s gone really well,” Dalot said. “He made an impact straight away in terms of his philosophy and the way he wants us to play. It suits the standards of the club – high-intensity football and working hard for the team.

“We have to give credit to him and his staff for all the information they gave us. It was really clear and obviously now we will take some more training sessions and games to put this into practice.

“He’s really demanding. He’s exactly what we need for this type of club. That’s the standard the club should have, by demanding people are really professional and working hard for the team. That’s the clear message that he gives us every day.”

[skip past newsletter promotion](https://www.theguardian.com/football/2024/nov/25/ruben-amorim-diogo-dalot-high-demands-manchester-united#EmailSignup-skip-link-9)after newsletter promotion

Amorim’s reserves of reputational credit run deep and the United travelling support got behind him at the outset, singing his name to the tune of Give It Up by KC & The Sunshine Band. What frustrated Amorim was how his team surrendered the initiative after Rashford’s goal. The buildup play from the back became jammed, the fluidity missing. United would be indebted to the goalkeeper, André Onana, for three big saves.

“The message he \[Amorim\] gave to everybody was clear – he wants us to have more control of the games,” Dalot said. “And that’s what we want to do. With me \[as the left wing-back\] it was: ‘Sprint back and be really hard-working. Give an option and don’t be afraid to have the ball.’ I felt comfortable. I’ve played on the left a couple of times now and the system is good for this club. I’ve played with three centre-backs before.”

**Subscribe to Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly newsletter from one of the world’s top soccer journalists.**

I’m lucky enough to have been able to turn a childhood soccer obsession into a 24-year career that has included 13 books, regular columns in the best publications in the world and regular namechecks on Ted Lasso.

Now, I’m writing a weekly newsletter about European football aimed at a US audience, and I hope you consider signing up for it. Each week, alongside my regular column in the Observer, the Guardian’s sister Sunday paper, I’ll be looking at the biggest stories from the weekend’s action, along with issues affecting the global game.

Subscribers can expect it in their inbox every Monday. It’s entirely free and quite straightforward to cancel, so why not subscribe now?

Jonathan Wilson
